```
r}   Warning   InspectFailed   kubelet, gke-kubernetes-cluster-pool-1-76a09ebd-b587   Failed to apply default image tag "<http://gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f|gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f>": couldn't parse image reference "<http://gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f|gcr.io/google_containers/hyperkube-amd64:v1.8.0+0b9efaeb34a2f>": invalid reference format
2017-10-04 14:07:14 +0200 CEST   2017-10-04 14:00:47 +0200 CEST   31        fed-zone-europe-controller-manager-4130961042-m9c3z.14ea5c3e2a63466e   Pod                 Warning   FailedSync   kubelet, gke-kubernetes-cluster-pool-1-76a09ebd-b587   Error syncing pod
```

How do people work around that? Information is here: <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/53430>

Hi all we are observing a strange behvaiour where rbac/v1 apis are getting available only after ~5-6 mins on api-server start up, had raised an issue <https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/56899> is anyone else also seeing this? It happens only when we migrate 1.7.7 to 1.8.4. After moving to 1.8.4 even if we restart API server, rbac/v1 apis are immediately available
